author: appliedblockchain
title: Trustless Cardano Ethereum bridge
description: Taxas insustentáveis levaram a uma migração de liquidez do Ethereum. A aplicação da Blockchain "London Bridge" encaminhará a liquidez para Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0: Atualmente só temos a ponte Cardano Ethereum da SingularityNET que está sendo desenvolvida e funcionando em testnet. Entretanto, esta ponte da SingularityNET é uma ponte autorizada, enquanto que a idéia do proponente é fazer uma ponte sem confiança. O proponente articula claramente como é importante ter uma ponte Cardano Ethereum sem confiança para que qualquer um possa usá-la. Com transações de custo relativamente baixo usando Cardano, atrairá mais projetos do Ethereum para se mudar para Cardano, já que é mais econômico fazer sentido ter um custo operacional mais barato, ao mesmo tempo em que é seguro e seguro.
f6_assessments.q1: A Applied Blockchain é uma empresa de consultoria que já tem histórico e experiência de trabalho com várias tecnologias de cadeias de blocos, e é explicada em detalhes em seu site. Isto também prova que o proponente conhece a composição da equipe necessária para trabalhar neste projeto a fim de torná-lo um sucesso. Embora o orçamento tenha sido delineado, ele precisa de mais explicações em detalhes, tais como: o número de pessoas envolvidas e as horas de trabalho com detalhes salariais. A discriminação de custos de US$ 25.000 para cada ponto não explica muito sobre o porquê de precisar de tal quantia de financiamento. Podemos ver a partir desta proposta que ela construirá uma nova estrutura de ponte em cadeia de blocos sem confiança chamada "London Bridge", e será construída utilizando a tecnologia Intel SGX. Seria útil se eles pudessem explicar brevemente o que a Intel SGX faz, e também explicar como ela será implementada em detalhes. Por exemplo: explicando como o uso da Intel SGX pode ajudar na segurança, em que parte / aspecto será usado ao desenvolver a ponte, e quais são os desafios ao implementar este tipo de tecnologia. Ao dar uma explicação breve e fácil de entender, será provado ainda mais que a equipe conhece a tecnologia que está utilizando. Esta proposta diz que a Ponte de Londres já está sendo integrada com uma série de outras correntes de bloqueio, mas ao pesquisar, é difícil encontrar qualquer informação sobre a Ponte de Londres e sua história. Ela também diz que será de código aberto, mas não tem nenhum link GitHub ou algo similar. No total, eu ainda lhe daria um 4 de viabilidade desde que eles provaram sua experiência com projetos anteriores de cadeias de blocos com KLM, Toyota, Shell, etc.
f6_assessments.q2: Esta proposta é capaz de fornecer um roteiro claro. Cada roteiro contém metas e objetivos a serem alcançados, desde os primeiros 2 meses de desenvolvimento até a sua implantação em testnets. No entanto, seria mais útil se eles especificassem as métricas/KPIs, como por exemplo: O número de projetos que migraram para Cardano nos primeiros 6 meses para serem considerados como um sucesso, o número de pessoas que participaram dos testes, etc.

f6_assessments.q0: Having this credible company, well estabished in the Ethereum world decide to come into the Cardano ecosystem is exactly the sort of adoption driving initiative that our community needs. With their existing track record and experience, their clients and competitors will take much more serious notice of Cardano and the protocol's features. One of the best things that can happen for our community.
f6_assessments.q1: That the major energy company, Shell, has invested in Applied Blockchain lends tremendous credibility that they will accomplish the goals they have set out. Experience having created a large number smart contracts would have allowed them to learn many lessons which will increase the effectiveness of their work in the Cardano community. I would recommend that they include links to their company at least in the comments section, but best in the body of their proposal. One of the very important elements that makes the proposal more feasible, is the wallet receiving the funds is a corporate wallet, not a personal wallet of an employee. Every major request for funding should be organised like that.
f6_assessments.q2: The road map is clear and auditable. Most importantly they are producing code, the development of which is within their control. And not dependent on externalities, as are so many other proposals.

f6_assessments.q0: Any project that could shift liquidity toward Cardano is a plus. I am concerned with regulatory issues that this could present, but hopefully after development time: more lobbying and legislation would be in place to where it isn't much of a concern.
f6_assessments.q1: I had trouble finding exactly where this group's qualifications were at. If this is the same as https://appliedblockchain.com/ then I would have given more stars. Since CAs need to go through these proposals quickly: some links to websites and linked in profiles would have been handy without having to dig for them.
f6_assessments.q2: KPIs and other qualifications for a success is fairly detailed in this proposal. The basics would be: ETH liquidity transferred to Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0: I find this a good type of Dapp, bringing people from ethereum is a very good option for increasing Cardano ecosystem. Of course in DApps and Integrations the proposal addresses perfectly with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Plan is  no even well detailed but where is the team information? They say that they have developed 100+ smart contract dApps but, how can I be sure of that? I need more information about the team for giving more stars here.
f6_assessments.q2: Successul is well detailed but I would like to see a roadmap for auditing the progress . I also like when proposals provide kpis which are measurable and very useful.

f6_assessments.q0: There is an increasing need to field a value migration system into Cardano from the Ethereum network, in a fast-track manner. The proposal is addressing this concern in a staring forward and in an open-source manner. Therefore it is addressing the core challenge in the Cardano ecosystem currently.
f6_assessments.q1: Applied Blockchain website has impressive references from major corporate houses like Shell and also has a good Github repo to showcase the developmental efforts. The pan presented is to the point and has referenced examples in a meaningful manner. With this information, we can assume that the project will be implemented in the best possible manner.
f6_assessments.q2: Applied Blockchain will develop the London bridge for facilitating secure value migration from Etherium to Cardano. The progress thus will be monitorable. The scope is also well defined and final end state is unambiguous, therefore we will be able to monitor the progress and measure the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposers idea is to create a bridge between Etherium and Cardano to better the liquidity of the cardano ecosystem. Because of the high gas fees the etherium users will have an economic incentive to move their assets in a cardano enabled way which makes sense. If implemented this project will add value to the cardano ecosystem, by boosting liquidity and migratin users from etherium. No key metrics were mentioned, so I can't say they align with the challenge settings. Not much technical details are linked or explained so I don't know if the proposers can address future challenges. The proposal is lacking in a few respects: No resources, links names or credentials KPIs or metrics of any kind are mentioned in the proposal.  As a developer I find the lack of detailed information technical and otherwise alarming.
f6_assessments.q1: No evidence is provided (links, references credentials) so it's hard for me to believe this project would be feasable. The mentioned relevant skills can not be verified in any way, so I don't count on them. No specific plan for a type or number of team members is present in the proposal, which is a red flag for me since any practical proposal would need people to do it. The budget is mentioned but there's no concrete breakdown or explanation on what specific work needs to be done and an hourly rate to do it. I have no idea if the timetable offered for implementation is good or not, because no technical specs or architecture is provided. As a developer I would have been able to estimate at least if the timetable is sensible or not for the job stated to be done. No time is mentioned concerning the integration of the implemented bridge. The deffinition of success is good, but it mentiones what it should accomplish, but the proposal doesn't state how would it support it. No resources of any kind are mentioned as necessary to implement the proposal. Having looked at over 30 proposals by now, this is very odd to me. The technical aspects like architecture language or technologies that are goind to be used for the implemention are never mentioned. A high level overview is not enough for a proposal of this magnitude.  I would love for this project to become a reality because it's a great idea, but as it stands now, I'd suggest to the authors of this proposal to have a look at other technical proposals and have a look through the proposal templates and questions to be answered. Make a better suggestion in the next Round8 and you'll be sure to be voted in! Good luck!
f6_assessments.q2: No mention on how the proposers plan to keep the community in the loop for the progress of the implementaion of the proposal. KPIs and metrics are not metioned, but the definition of success seems correct, since integration betwen Etherium and Cardano is the most important milestone to cover. The roadmap is present but it could be a bit more concrete about the milestones and task segregation. The problem statement description is clear. The solution on the other hand needs some more work. Think about more non-technical people, because they'd react better if a more simple explanation and impact is provided.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal very effectively addresses the challenge it's presented in. As much liquidity seeks refuge from the ultra-high fee ethereum, many bridges will be needed to facilitate that enormous amount of traffic.

There proposal suggests utilising trusted Intel SGX chip modules to achieve this through a trust-less mechanism, similar to the way other DApps on polkadot have done.
f6_assessments.q1:
I believe the cost breakdown to presents a realistic budget for achieving this proposals goal of integration with the ethereum blockchain.

I would advise providing full team information in the proposal itself instead of asking community advisors and voters to have to google all your companies information separately!

Other than that, the team has indeed deploy many DApps on ethereum and it is my opinion that they will be very successful with this proposal to integrate their "London Bridge" into Cardano.
f6_assessments.q2: Roadmap is detailed contains reasonable milestones that make sense in the context of the proposal. Would like a few more specifics regarding the exact KPIs to track in order to more comprehensively audit the proposal, but other than that we have plenty of information we can use as the milestones are obvious sensible.

f6_assessments.q0: The majority of users of the many Ethereum products will only consider migrating to a new blockchain if they can move their assets, either to take advantage of lower fees or faster network finality. The impact of the influx of liquidity and non-fungible assets to Cardano could be very meaningful for the ecosystem. A number of bridges will have to facilitate interoperability in the future and the solution presented by this proposal seems like a robust if a bit too centralised option. I foresee fixing the centralisation issue will be the biggest hurdle of this project in the long run, but the team seems invested in getting there.
f6_assessments.q1: A well-written proposal by a team that seems to have the necessary technical competence to implement the proposal. I wish however that this was more than an impression and actual concrete data about the team would have been provided like bios, references or examples of previous work. The lack of these is by far the weakest point of the proposal. If the proposal does not receive funding in the current round I would strongly encourage them to add the necessary info in a future iteration.
f6_assessments.q2:
The breakdown of the budget is not very detailed, but other than that all the elements required to facilitate the auditing process are present in the proposal with the exception of the estimated launch date, which is the least important one in this CAs opinion. KPIs, the definition of success are there and mostly complete.
The roadmap clearly describes the intentions of the proposer and provides adequate information on how this is going to be implemented and what the community should follow.

solution: A ponte sem confiança permitirá aos usuários mover as fichas padrão do Ethereum para Cardano, proporcionando um ecossistema mais ativo para a DeFi e NFT.
experience: Nós implantamos mais de 100 DApps de contrato inteligente de cadeia de blocos: Mercados NFT, protocolos DeFi, plataformas de lançamento de projetos, plataformas de negociação de derivativos.
